src: In an effort to defuse the tension with the farmers, the government agreed to a gradual removal of the diesel subsidy over three years and to keeping the exemption from the car tax. The farmers pooh-poohed the concessions as insufficient. On January 4th an aggressive group of them prevented Robert Habeck, the economy minister, from disembarking from a ferry on his return from a family holiday. If the train drivers are similarly unimpressed, that could prove expensive for German business, reckons IW Köln, a think-tank. The rail strike could cost businesses €100m ($110m) a day if it forced them to interrupt production. The car, chemical and steel industries, Germany's biggest, are especially reliant on rail transport.
tgt: Pour essayer d'atténuer les tensions avec les agriculteurs, le gouvernement a accepté d'étaler la suppression des subventions pour le diesel sur trois ans et de maintenir l'exonération fiscale automobile. Les agriculteurs ont dédaigné ces concessions, les jugeant insuffisantes. Le 4 janvier, un groupe virulent d'agriculteurs a empêché le ministre de l'Économie, Robert Habeck, de descendre d'un ferry à son retour d'un séjour en famille. Si les conducteurs de train partagent cet état d'esprit, cela pourrait se révéler coûteux pour l'économie allemande, reconnaît le think tank IW Köln. La grève des chemins de fer pourrait coûter aux entreprises 100 000 € (110 000 $) par jour si elle les contraint à interrompre leur production. Les industries automobiles, chimiques et sidérurgiques, les plus grosses d'Allemagne, dépendent en effet beaucoup du transport ferroviaire.

src: Thomas Puls of IW Köln fears that the strikes will harm the image of Germany as a place for business. Local bosses are already fretting about a German version of the gilets jaunes protests in France in 2018, which culminated in yellow-jacketed demonstrators torching cars on the Champs-Elysées and the police stepping in with tear gas. Jochen Kopelke, head of Germany's police union, warned in an interview with Tagesspiegel, a daily, that the farmers were probably "just the start of an enormous wave of protest this year." Germany was the only big economy to shrink in 2023, and the year ended on an especially sour note, with an unexpected drop in business confidence in December. This year is shaping up to be even tougher.
tgt: Thomas Puls, d'IW Köln, craint que les grèves ne nuisent à l'image de pays propice aux affaires de l'Allemagne. Jochen Kopelke, à la tête du syndicat de la police allemande, a prévenu, dans une entrevue accordée au quotidien Tagesspiegel, que le mouvement des agriculteurs n'était probablement que "le début d'une énorme vague de manifestations cette année". L'Allemagne a été la seule grande puissance économique à connaître une récession en 2023, année qui s'est achevée sur une note particulièrement amère, matérialisée par une baisse inattendue de la confiance des entreprises en décembre. L'année présente s'annonce plus difficile encore.

src: Masterfully working across subject matter, Siso has generated a prolific series of landscapes, portraits, and still-life works rendered in either acrylic, pastel, pencil or watercolor. Drawing from family portraits, his own reference photographs, and recollection, his colorful compositions demonstrate his range of interests and skill across media. Siso's tropical landscapes and seascapes reflect the geographies of his past, employing rich patterns and incorporating people to make meaningful connections between culture, memory and the environment. Siso titles his artworks in a mix of Spanish and English, signifying the celebrated and integral complexities of his life in Los Angeles County. "Vicente Siso: Memories of the Land and Water" opens on Saturday, Jan. 13, with a reception from 6-8 p.m. The exhibition is on view through Sunday, March 3.

Ses paysages tropicaux et marins sont le reflet des lieux de son passé, avec leurs motifs riches et leurs personnages qui font le lien entre la culture, les souvenirs et l'environnement. Siso donne à ses œuvres des titres qui mélangent espagnol et anglais, comme pour célébrer toute la complexité de sa vie dans le comté de Los Angeles. L'exposition "Vicente Siso: Memories of the Land and Water" débute le samedi 13 janvier par une réception, prévue entre 18h et 20h. Elle se tiendra jusqu'au dimanche 3 mars.

src: The problems at the EPA are distinct but not unrelated to those at the Department of Justice, which handles environmental crimes via its Environment and Natural Resources Division, or ENRD. Prior to joining the EPA, Uhlmann - the EPA assistant secretary for enforcement - had served as the longtime head of that division's Environmental Crimes Section, from 1990 through 2007. The EPA sends its most serious civil and criminal cases to ENRD, which - as a relatively underfunded office - often relies on other agencies in helping to choose which fights to take on. In fiscal year 2022, the EPA deferred fewer cases to DOJ (88) than at any point since 2000 and concluded fewer civil judicial cases than it had since that time, as well. As the Environmental Integrity Project notes, even Trump's EPA concluded 94 civil cases and deferred 106 cases per year to the DOJ per year, on average.

src: Reversing the trend of jail deaths, and solving the many other issues facing our jails, may require some difficult policy decisions. Independent oversight is a demonstrated means of improving transparency and accountability both in Washington and across the country. By our count, at least 25 states have a statewide office responsible for overseeing jails, and all of them have a lower rate of jail deaths than Washington.

src: Independent oversight will promote public trust and data-driven decision-making in a field that has for too long operated without the benefit of transparency. We ask the Legislature to enact into law our task force's recommendation to restore independent oversight of our state's city, county, and regional jails. People's lives depend on it.

Nous demandons au Parlement de voter une loi intégrant la recommandation de notre groupe de travail de restaurer une surveillance indépendante de nos prisons municipales, de comté et régionales. Des vies en dépendent.

1. **"Independent oversight"**:
   - This phrase refers to an impartial supervision or evaluation. In French, a direct translation ("supervision indépendante") might not convey the same authority and connotation of oversight typically understood in governance contexts.
   - Alternative phrases could be "surveillance indépendante" or "contrôle indépendant".

2. **"Promote public trust"**:
   - The concept of "public trust" can be nuanced in French. A direct translation ("confiance publique") may not fully capture the associative meaning of social reliability and confidence.
   - One alternative could be "favoriser la confiance du public".

3. **"Data-driven decision-making"**:
   - This expression refers to making decisions based on data analysis, which is often indicative of a more systematic or scientific approach.
   - A viable translation could be "prise de décision basée sur les données".

   - The phrase "without the benefit of transparency" suggests functioning in a way that lacks openness, which may be challenging to convey.

5. **"Task force's recommendation"**:
   - The term "task force" refers to a group assembled to study a specific issue, which might not have an exact equivalent in French.

6. **"Restore independent oversight"**:
   - The act of "restoring" is often associated with returning to a previous state, and the phrase "independent oversight" remains important to translate with precision.
   - A translation could be "restaurer la surveillance indépendante".

7. **"People's lives depend on it"**:
   - This phrase conveys urgency and importance. A direct translation ("La vie des gens dépend de cela") might sound too literal.
   - It could be translated more idiomatically as "La vie des gens en dépend", which feels more natural in French.

With these considerations in mind, the translation process can proceed to the drafting stage, ensuring that all idiomatic and contextual nuances are preserved in the target language.

src: Thus, we had the introduction of the Cost of Living (Tenant protection) (Scotland) Act 2022 nearly 18 months ago which sought to cap rents for a limited period to ease the pressures of the cost-of-living crisis. What we find now from the latest Scottish Government statistics is that, in the last year alone, average rents have increased in all sized properties, ranging from the lowest rise of 11.7 per cent for one-bedroom to the highest figure of 14.3 per cent for two-bedroom homes. Every type of property (from one to four bedroom to a room in a property) has had a double digit increase in rents since the Cost of Living legislation was introduced in October 2022, exceeding the annual average increases in rents over the previous 12 years by a factor of at least three.

D'après les derniers chiffres du gouvernement écossais, pour la seule année écoulée, la moyenne des loyers a augmenté pour les biens de toutes tailles, de 11,7 % pour les deux-pièces jusqu'à 14,3 % pour les trois-pièces. Chaque type de biens (d'une à quatre chambres, ou chambre seule) a connu une augmentation à deux chiffres depuis la loi sur le coût de la vie introduite en octobre 2022, dépassant ainsi les hausses moyennes annuelles des loyers constatées sur les 12 années précédentes, en les multipliant par trois.

src: Unfortunately, this consultation paper seems like a further attempt to impose controls on the sector. A far simpler solution would be to let the market return to normal, not impose external controls on rent levels, and the result will be lower rent increases than we have seen in the last 18 months. To stabilise rental prices in the long term then the government must encourage greater investment and growth in the private rented sector (PRS) while simultaneously funding a substantial growth in the supply of social housing. The greater the investment in the PRS the more stability will be created in the housing market. Increasing volumes in both the PRS and social housing markets will stabilise rents over time as demand meets supply and equilibrium is achieved. Only by adopting these measures will we start to address the current housing crisis. Anything else is simply not going to work.
tgt: Hélas, ce document de consultation ressemble fort à une énième tentative de contrôle du secteur. Une solution bien plus simple consisterait à laisser le marché retourner à la normale et à ne pas imposer de contrôles externes sur les niveaux de loyer. Il en résulterait des hausses des loyers moins importantes que celles nous avons constatées ces 18 derniers mois. Pour stabiliser les loyers sur le long terme, le gouvernement se doit d'encourager l'investissement et la croissance dans le secteur locatif privé, en finançant dans le même temps une croissance substantielle de l'offre de logements sociaux. Plus les investissements dans le secteur privé seront importants, plus le marché du logement sera stable. La croissance dans ce secteur et dans le logement social stabilisera les loyers au fil du temps, à mesure que la demande et l'offre s'équilibreront. Ce n'est qu'en adoptant ces mesures que nous pourrons faire face à la crise actuelle du logement. Toute autre politique est vouée à l'échec.

- **"performing music"**

src: The enemy of my enemy is my friend. Disagree! If the enemy of your enemy were your friend, he'd explicitly be your friend. You know, oftentimes people can work together for a time, united by their dislike for something or someone. But if that relationship was conceived by your mutual dislike for whatever that thing is, what's to stop that relationship from dissolving or becoming hostile after that thing is taken care of? Like, the foundation of a friendship is much more stable than that. But, you know, I also understand the short-term strategy behind it, so I'll just disagree.
tgt: L'ennemi de mon ennemi est mon ami. Pas d'accord ! Si l'ennemi de votre ennemi était votre ami, il serait explicitement votre ami. Vous savez, souvent les gens peuvent travailler ensemble pendant un moment, unis par leur aversion pour quelque chose ou quelqu'un. Mais si cette relation était née de votre aversion mutuelle pour peu importe ce que ce soit, qu'est-ce qui l'empêcherait de se dissoudre ou de s'envenimer une fois l'objet de cette aversion écarté ? Les fondements d'une amitié sont beaucoup plus solides que ça. Mais, vous savez, je comprends également la stratégie à court terme derrière tout ça, donc je vais juste exprimer mon désaccord.

1. **"The enemy of my enemy is my friend."**
   - This is a common saying that implies a strategic alliance based on mutual opposition. While there is a French equivalent ("L'ennemi de mon ennemi est mon ami"), direct translations can sometimes miss the nuance of strategy and friendship that follows.

2. **"Disagree!"**
   - This is direct but can be expressed differently in French to convey a more nuanced response. A more idiomatic way may be to say, "Je ne suis pas d'accord !" or "Je ne suis pas de cet avis !"

3. **"If the enemy of your enemy were your friend, he'd explicitly be your friend."**
   - This phrase emphasizes the lack of genuine friendship in a strategic alliance. The challenge lies in capturing the tone of certainty and the layered meaning. 

4. **"But if that relationship was conceived by your mutual dislike for whatever that thing is..."**
   - The expression "conceived by your mutual dislike" can be tricky to convey literally and may need to be rephrased to ensure clarity and fluidity in French.

5. **"What's to stop that relationship from dissolving or becoming hostile...?"**
   - This phrase contains a rhetorical question that highlights the fragility of relationships based on dislike. "What's to stop" is an idiomatic expression that can be translated in various ways to maintain the rhetorical impact.

6. **"Like, the foundation of a friendship is much more stable than that."**
   - The phrase "much more stable than that" contains an implied comparison that may need to be articulated more explicitly in French.

7. **"I also understand the short-term strategy behind it..."**
   - The term "short-term strategy" is an idiomatic expression that conveys more than just a tactical approach; it's about temporary alliances which might need a suitable translation to resonate similarly in French.

3. **"satisfactory to both sides"**:
   - This expression implies that both parties in a legal case find the jury acceptable. In French, one might say "satisfaisant pour les deux parties".

4. **"We accept the jury"**:
   - This is straightforward, but it might be more naturally expressed in French as "Nous acceptons le jury".

5. **"Swear the jury"**:
   - This is a legal command to formally administer an oath to the jury members. In French, this could be translated as "Faites prêter serment au jury".

- **"satisfactory to both sides"** = "satisfaisant pour les deux parties"

step-1:
In the provided context, the phrase "It's not that bad, right, Kayel?" contains an idiomatic expression that reflects a colloquial conversation and seeks validation or agreement. Let's break down the components:

### 1. Context and Connotation:
- **"It's not that bad"**: This phrase is often used to provide reassurance or to downplay a negative situation. In English, it might imply that the situation is better than it seems or that there are positive aspects worth considering.
  
- **"right, Kayel?"**: This seeks affirmation from a specific person (Kayel), indicating a casual or friendly tone.

### 2. Challenges in Translation:
Translating idiomatic expressions requires an understanding of both linguistic and cultural nuances. Direct translations can often lose the original meaning or sound unnatural. 

### 3. Considerations for French Translation:
- **Conveying the Tone**: The sense of reassurance and seeking agreement must be preserved in French.
- **Familiarity with the Person**: The use of "Kayel" signifies a degree of familiarity or friendship that should be maintained in the French version.

### 4. Possible Translations:
- **Direct Translation**: "Ce n'est pas si mauvais, n'est-ce pas, Kayel ?" 
  - While this translation is grammatically correct, it may lack the same colloquial warmth and familiarity.

- **Alternative Translational Connotations**: More colloquial or natural-sounding expressions might include:
  - “Ce n’est pas si terrible, hein, Kayel ?” 
  - “Ce n'est pas si dramatique, n'est-ce pas, Kayel ?”
  - “C'est pas si mal que ça, non, Kayel?”

src: I hold a relatively slow pace as I approach the door, giving a small holler to Dad. “I’ll be heading out for a bit, dinner is in the fridge.” No response. Figures. He usually hears me though, he’ll probably be fine. Slowly closing the door behind me, I let another breathy sigh escape as the door completely shut. Nearly forgetting, I place my hand on the cold, metallic scanner that locks the door. If there was anything this apartment had, it was advanced tech, but then again; most places had notable technology–it had been a long time since anyone had used any other different technology.

src: To create the antique brass ornament, I just went in with a coat of rub and buff onto the entire ornament there. And then of course, we have to get that antique look with the alcohol ink. So I went in with ginger first. I applied a droplet onto our ornament and just blended it out like so. And I just continued that process until I had as many layers as I liked, and it looked really antiqued in like an actual metal ornament. After that, I did go in with a little bit more of that burnished amber spray paint as well, and just applied that to the surface, to kind of give it that oxidized look like we did for the bell ornaments. And that is how I finished off these antique brass bobbles. Really simple and easy, but honestly, they look like real metal and they're beautiful.

Listening to his advice. I couldn’t bring myself to stay longer. Fuck, Al. I quickly ran for it after exiting the vent; it hurt a bit to lose such an invaluable friend. Were they moving him to the…other city? So many things were flicking through my slightly scattered mind, and most of them were angry but sad. I’d done numerous kinds of research on the outer cities, and the capital of the infected, Alcatraz, which they named after the prison – felt like it fit the name pretty well from what I’d read. Not to mention the unmutated had cut any remaining connecting land with infected land, it was…tragic.

src: Irregularly, Anton’s was pretty busy; it was bustling with activity and new faces that I’ve never seen before – Anton was regularly the only worker, so knowing that he must be pretty stressed. “Hey Barkeep, get me a coffee.” I purposely spoke in a lower tone to throw him off a bit, a small chuckle escaping me seeing his sigh of relief after turning quickly. “God, Lilith, don’t do that to me…” he softly let out, obviously tired. “You seem pretty busy…you need some help? Look’s like there's more than plenty of folks here.” I huffed out, I do not want to help with these drunks, but I feel bad making this guy work alone out here. “Could you? I’ll pay you after…” he uttered with the eyes of a puppy, aimed straight at me. Advanced War Tactics…
tgt: Contrairement à l'ordinaire, le bar d'Anton était assez fréquenté. Il grouillait de monde et de nouveaux visages que je n'avais encore jamais vus. Anton était régulièrement le seul à travailler. Sachant cela, il devait être plutôt stressé. "Hé patron, un café !", dis-je à voix basse exprès, pour le déboussoler, en laissant échapper un petit rire quand je l'entendis soupirer de soulagement après s'être retourné rapidement. "Bon sang, Lilith, ne me fais pas ça...", lâcha-t-il doucement, visiblement fatigué. "Tu as l'air débordé. Tu as besoin d'un coup de main ? On dirait qu'il y a foule aujourd'hui". Je soupirai, je ne veux pas l'aider à servir ces ivrognes, mais je me sens mal à l'idée de laisser ce gars travailler tout seul. "Tu pourrais ? Je te paierai après...", articula-t-il, le regard implorant, dirigé droit vers moi. Tactiques martiales avancées...
